lines.speaker: u4584
lines.text: I came to see you, you look fine.  We gotta go.

lines.speaker: u4580
lines.text: Vincent.  It was nice to meet you. Visit again?

lines.speaker: u4584
lines.text: ...oh God, don't shoot me...

lines.speaker: u4581
lines.text: ...show me the wallet, man, get your ass up, <u>up</u>...

lines.speaker: u4584
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.speaker: u4582
lines.text: Where you been the last two hours? Your mother's been calling every ten minutes whining about how you didn't show up.

lines.speaker: u4583
lines.text: ...why is everything always about you...

lines.speaker: u4588
lines.text: ...everything is not about me, don't make me the villain here.  That asshole was out of line, and you goddamn well know it...

lines.speaker: u4583
lines.text: ...I'm sorry, I don't see it that way...

lines.speaker: u4588
lines.text: ...oh, bullshit!  He was intruding on my space, he was demeaning me personally, he was patronizing...

lines.speaker: u4583
lines.text: ...what do you want me to do, punch him out?  I have to work with him...

lines.speaker: u4588
lines.text: ...well, last I checked, you were <u>sleeping</u> with me, so unless you wanna start fucking the guy soon, I'd suggest an attitude shift...

lines.speaker: u4587
lines.text: Max?

lines.speaker: u4584
lines.text: Let her go.

lines.speaker: u4589
lines.text: They said send you downstairs.

lines.speaker: u4595
lines.text: Who?

lines.speaker: u4589
lines.text: The F.B.I., the C.I.A.  You name the initials and they're down there.

lines.speaker: u4595
lines.text: Any special reason?

lines.speaker: u4589
lines.text: All I know is, they said to send you and the body to the basement.

lines.speaker: u4592
lines.text: I was only going one way.

lines.speaker: u4590
lines.text: Drop me off here!

lines.speaker: u4592
lines.text: Look, I'm sorry --

lines.speaker: u4590
lines.text: Just drop me off.

lines.speaker: u4592
lines.text: Flip.  You're the closest thing I got to a friend around here.  Tell me something.  You think I'm crazy?

lines.speaker: u4591
lines.text: Shut the hell up.

lines.speaker: u4592
lines.text: I'll do it.  On one condition.  I want to make sure she's okay.

lines.speaker: u4596
lines.text: We got someone watching her 24 hours a day.  She --

lines.speaker: u4592
lines.text: That's not what I mean.  I want to see her.

lines.speaker: u4596
lines.text: I don't know...

lines.speaker: u4592
lines.text: Then screw you.  I'll rot.

lines.speaker: u4596
lines.text: Alright.  You can see her.  But she can't see you.

lines.speaker: u4592
lines.text: Whatever.

lines.speaker: u4595
lines.text: It's okay.  I'm game.

lines.speaker: u4593
lines.text: I want this box rigged with a beacon!

lines.speaker: u4594
lines.text: Liza, settle a bet for us.

lines.speaker: u4595
lines.text: What do I look like to you? Switzerland?

lines.speaker: u4596
lines.text: I'm, it really doesn't matter. Think C.I.A. and exponentiate. I'm a government employee and I've been watching Jerry for awhile.

lines.speaker: u4595
lines.text: And Jonas?

lines.speaker: u4596
lines.text: He's why I watch Jerry.  Jerry's the bait for Jonas.

lines.speaker: u4595
lines.text: He's shown himself.  Why haven't you arrested him or killed him or done whatever it is you do?

lines.speaker: u4596
lines.text: Jonas builds assassins for a living.  Several of whom may be in place already.  We'd like to kill a few birds with one stone.

lines.speaker: u4595
lines.text: Where do you think Jerry is?

lines.speaker: u4596
lines.text: No idea.  Honest.  What are you going to do?

lines.speaker: u4595
lines.text: I'm going to find him.  Because he'd find me.

lines.speaker: u4596
lines.text: Don't go home.  And don't go to work.  Either one could be bad.

lines.speaker: u4595
lines.text: What do you suggest?

lines.speaker: u4596
lines.text: That you come with me.

lines.speaker: u4595
lines.text: I don't think so.

lines.speaker: u4599
lines.text: We've lost contact.

lines.speaker: u4609
lines.text: Pull the plug.  Get her out of there.

lines.speaker: u4599
lines.text: There's no plug to pull.

lines.speaker: u4609
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: u4599
lines.text: There is no abort procedure -- we don't know how we turned the damn thing on, let alone how to turn it off.

lines.speaker: u4600
lines.text: You don't believe it to be... tell me something, Doctor.  Why do you think they would go to all this trouble... bring you tens of thousands of light years, and then send you home without a shred of proof?  Sort of bad form, wouldn't you say?  What was their intent?

lines.speaker: u4602
lines.text: I don't know.  Ultimately their motives may be as incomprehensible as their technology.

lines.speaker: u4601
lines.text: Ellie... we both know that if I was any kind of a man, I never would've entered this race.  That I would have told the President straight out:  Helen, Eleanor Arroway is naive and strident and an enormous pain in the ass... but she's got more courage and intelligence than the rest of us put together.  That more then anyone else on the planet, she's earned this.  And that she should be the one to go because she's the best we have.  But that's not who I am.  I like to think it's who I might've been if things had gone a different way; that I might have been worthy, really worthy of what I've been given...  You do what you have to do.  And in the end, as with everything, it comes down to power.  And it isn't fair...

lines.speaker: u4602
lines.text: What would you have me say, David?

lines.speaker: u4601
lines.text: Nothing.  I guess I just wanted to thank you.

lines.speaker: u4602
lines.text: Thank you?

lines.speaker: u4601
lines.text: For giving me a chance, just for a moment, to feel what it must be like to be you.

lines.speaker: u4602
lines.text: You kill me, you really do.  The first truly global, a-political event in history and you can't wait to spin it.

lines.speaker: u4611
lines.text: How would you propose we handle it, Doctor?

lines.speaker: u4602
lines.text: I guess I'd say I trust us enough to believe our response would be something to the effect of, thanks for the advice, but no thanks.  But to dilute or censor the truth, for whatever reason --

lines.speaker: u4611
lines.text: Nobody is proposing we censor the truth here, Doctor.  We're simply talking about putting a mechanism in place --

lines.speaker: u4602
lines.text: For managing the truth.  But the truth won't be managed, sir.  It stops being the truth the moment you try.

lines.speaker: u4607
lines.text: ... as have all attempts at internal analysis.  We've tried sonargrams, magnetic resonance, gamma rays; it's completely impenetrable.

lines.speaker: u4610
lines.text: Recommendations?

lines.speaker: u4607
lines.text: I don't know.  Maybe we built the damn thing wrong.  Maybe it was all a hoax...  The safest thing would probably be to do a Chernobyl; encase it in concrete.

lines.speaker: u4610
lines.text: Have your department make a full report.

lines.speaker: u4622
lines.text: Hot damn, Drag. Tomorrow's Saturday. Another week almost made.

lines.speaker: u4614
lines.text: I got two years.

lines.speaker: u4615
lines.text: You allus had good jobs, and that girl in Kentucky I taken a shine to her.

lines.speaker: u4623
lines.text: She took off with that convertible feller...

lines.speaker: u4615
lines.text: Well, why not? Idee of marryin' got you all choked up, trying to pretend you was respectable you was borin' the hell out of all of us.

lines.speaker: u4623
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: u4615
lines.text: I'm leavin' the place to John.

lines.speaker: u4623
lines.text: That's good: he earned it.

lines.speaker: u4615
lines.text: Nothin' to do with it. I ain't never give John the kind of feelin' I give you, so I'm payin' him off now. Don't feel you got to say anything. Way it is, sometimes, you just have a feelin' for a child or you don't, and with John I just didn't.

lines.speaker: u4623
lines.text: Gotta go, Arletta.

lines.speaker: u4615
lines.text: Laugh it up, kid. You'll make out.

lines.speaker: u4621
lines.text: We saw the broads.

lines.speaker: u4616
lines.text: Yeah. Did you have them both at once or --

lines.speaker: u4617
lines.text: Here's the Patrol.

lines.speaker: u4619
lines.text: She's got him! You hear that?

lines.speaker: u4618
lines.text: You gonna get used to wearing them chains aftera while, Luke. But don't you never stop listenin' to them clinkin'. That's gonna remind you of what I been sayin'.

lines.speaker: u4623
lines.text: Yeah, they sure do make a lot of cold, hard, noise, Captain.

lines.speaker: u4620
lines.text: Oh Lord!

lines.speaker: u4624
lines.text: That fool. That damn fool.

lines.speaker: u4620
lines.text: Oh mah baby Luke.

lines.speaker: u4622
lines.text: Oh no, man! Not on this hot muther.

lines.speaker: u4621
lines.text: All the bears gonna be walking today.

lines.speaker: u4622
lines.text: I don't see no sign of guts in you.

lines.speaker: u4624
lines.text: No. No chains either.

lines.speaker: u4622
lines.text: You ain't man enough to wear them!

lines.speaker: u4624
lines.text: But you're dog enough. Maybe they'll let you sleep outside the box near your master.

lines.speaker: u4622
lines.text: Big deal paper hanger! Hell, anyone who can write can pass fifty-sixty dollar checks. Like breakin' open a piggy bank.

lines.speaker: u4624
lines.text: You've been having bad luck with masters, haven't you? Your last one left you when the cops came... and now Luke. You should complain to the S.P.C.A.

lines.speaker: u4622
lines.text: You phony creep!

lines.speaker: u4626
lines.text: She just got to sleep.  Do you have to tell her about it now?

lines.speaker: u4631
lines.text: Tell her about <u>what</u>?

lines.speaker: u4626
lines.text: Gaahhd!  What a <u>cop</u>!  You busted me!  The new one, in the Marina.  She has a police radio scanner. It's always on.  She turns it off, and then she has to turn it on again.  She's obsessed.  She can't not listen to it, but she can't listen to it, so she makes me listen to it.

lines.speaker: u4630
lines.text: The first two murders.

lines.speaker: u4627
lines.text: What first two murders.  We don't know about them here, do we?

lines.speaker: u4630
lines.text: He told me he had done two others just like it.

lines.speaker: u4627
lines.text: When was that?

lines.speaker: u4630
lines.text: When he was seventeen.

lines.speaker: u4627
lines.text: And you believed him when he told you he had done that.

lines.speaker: u4630
lines.text: Yes.  I believed him.

lines.speaker: u4628
lines.text: Daryll Lee Cullum, he wrote that book, he wanted the lady to have it.  They won't let him send it to her, so I'm getting out, he asks me to deliver it in person, he says, put it on her pillow.  It has all about how he tried to kill her.

lines.speaker: u4636
lines.text: He told you she was loaded, any- thing you could steal you could keep, Conrad?  You bought yourself a return ticket to Quentin, breaking and entering.

lines.speaker: u4628
lines.text: The door was already open...

lines.speaker: u4636
lines.text: We know...  Send the book to evidence...

lines.speaker: u4628
lines.text: She's supposed to have it.

lines.speaker: u4636
lines.text: She don't want it.

lines.speaker: u4630
lines.text: How was Conrad supposed to find Kurten?

lines.speaker: u4629
lines.text: Conrad has the phone number. Conrad, where is he?

lines.speaker: u4630
lines.text: In jail.

lines.speaker: u4629
lines.text: That Klutz.  They send him back here, I'll kick his ass good.

lines.speaker: u4637
lines.text: Ma'am, please get out of your vehicle...

lines.speaker: u4630
lines.text: Merry, how... oh, Christ, of course, you had my phone tapped.

lines.speaker: u4637
lines.text: Just get out of your vehicle...

lines.speaker: u4630
lines.text: He's got Sergeant Halloran in there.  He'll kill her the minute he sees or hears your people...

lines.speaker: u4637
lines.text: You've been very useful, Doctor, we appreciate all you've done, and now the professional will take over...

lines.speaker: u4630
lines.text: He wants me, he doesn't care about her.  Let me...

lines.speaker: u4638
lines.text: Inspector, will you confirm somebody is copying the Boston Strangler?  This is the fourth, is that correct?

lines.speaker: u4631
lines.text: We're going to review all the evidence carefully before making any statement...

lines.speaker: u4633
lines.text: He's not treating her right...

lines.speaker: u4635
lines.text: She left you, Nikko.  She's not your responsibility.  She takes very good care of herself.  If she wants to romance the kid, it ain't your business.  Your business is to snap out of it.

lines.speaker: u4633
lines.text: We were together six years, sir!

lines.speaker: u4635
lines.text: Don't give me six years!  You never divorced Patty, did you?  So what'd you expect from M.J.?

lines.speaker: u4633
lines.text: She knows I'm Catholic!  She never mentioned divorce!  Not once!

lines.speaker: u4635
lines.text: Then you shoulda known she wasn't buying.  She was just long-term leasing' you.  Ah, Nickie.  Except for that rare twenty-second twitch, there ain't nothin' about sex I don't hate. But of course, I'm Irish.  Plus I got <u>real</u> problems.  I'm worried I might have to put you in over M.J.  There's something going on here, the Commissioner is targeting her now, I can't leave a woman in that position.  But the thing is, how can I move <u>you</u> in, if you go on acting like a teenage asshole?

lines.speaker: u4633
lines.text: I don't want the job.  Don't do that to her.  She's worked too damned hard for it.

lines.speaker: u4635
lines.text: What's going down with the sting in Chinatown?  That gonna be off your plate in a week or what?

lines.speaker: u4639
lines.text: See, now you've annoyed her.  You know she doesn't like you to touch me.  Does she, widdle wee fing!  Wuhve you so much!  Did you feed her?

lines.speaker: u4634
lines.text: Yes, I fed her.  If she says she's hungry, she's lying to you.  Again.

lines.speaker: u4639
lines.text: She doesn't lie!  You sure you fed her?

lines.speaker: u4634
lines.text: She lies all the time.  Why would I say I fed her if I didn't?

lines.speaker: u4639
lines.text: That's what I don't know.  Why would you lie?  That's the problem... I can't understand why anyone would lie.

lines.speaker: u4642
lines.text: I think he'll be waiting for us at the airport

lines.speaker: u4640
lines.text: James.

lines.speaker: u4642
lines.text: Please finish your story.

lines.speaker: u4641
lines.text: The junior pathologist at Ashford Hospital. Then the husband of a colleague of mine, then a trainee radiologist, then the service manager at my garage.

lines.speaker: u4642
lines.text: And you had sex with all of these men in cars? Only in cars?

lines.speaker: u4641
lines.text: Yes. I didn't plan it that way.

lines.speaker: u4642
lines.text: And did you fantasize that Vaughan was photographing all these sex acts? As though they were traffic accidents?

lines.speaker: u4641
lines.text: Yes.  They felt like traffic accidents.

lines.speaker: u4644
lines.text: I need to see you, Ballard. I need to talk to you about the project.

lines.speaker: u4642
lines.text: Where are you?

lines.speaker: u4645
lines.text: So, we'll meet every Tuesday and Friday. And if you have any kind of emergency, you can page me.

lines.speaker: u4646
lines.text: OK, good. That's good. Thanks an awful lot for everything, and for coming down here to see me off.

lines.speaker: u4645
lines.text: It was just a little going-away gesture.

lines.speaker: u4646
lines.text: I have a going-away gesture for you, too.

lines.speaker: u4645
lines.text: Oh?

lines.speaker: u4652
lines.text: It's a very nice letter. But I have to go with what's best for the students.

lines.speaker: u4646
lines.text: What does that mean?

lines.speaker: u4652
lines.text: I need someone to work on budget projections.

lines.speaker: u4646
lines.text: Office work?

lines.speaker: u4652
lines.text: Or, of course, you could take a sabbatical the rest of the year.

lines.speaker: u4647
lines.text: Mrs. Hallstrom, why don't you join my family for dinner. You'll love my Grandma Rosa.

lines.speaker: u4648
lines.text: That's so sweet, Michael. But, really, I've so many things to do.

lines.speaker: u4671
lines.text: Jesus.   What kind of FBI agent are you?

lines.speaker: u4654
lines.text: I'm your worst fuckin' nightmare. Now, if you don't want me to keep on hurting you, it's important that I believe you and right now I don't. So tell me, where did they go?

lines.speaker: u4671
lines.text: I swear man, I don't know. They packed up and left a half hour ago.  All I got is one of their phone numbers in Paris.

lines.speaker: u4655
lines.text: Hello?

lines.speaker: u4658
lines.text: It's Daniel.

lines.speaker: u4655
lines.text: Daniel. Listen I'm afraid there has been a big--

lines.speaker: u4658
lines.text: -- I've got the tapes. If you ever want to see your brother out of jail do exactly what I say. Bring one million euros to your boat at six o'clock.

lines.speaker: u4655
lines.text: A million! I don't have that kind of money.

lines.speaker: u4658
lines.text: Don't bullshit me, Laurant!   I know about the Van Gogh.

lines.speaker: u4655
lines.text: I don't have it. That's why Vincent went to Chicago. They arrested him before he could bring it back.

lines.speaker: u4658
lines.text: Well, you better get the money somehow. Six o'clock and come alone. If you don't we'll destroy the tapes.

lines.speaker: u4672
lines.text: Can I offer you something.    A drink? Coffee?

lines.speaker: u4656
lines.text: No thank you.

lines.speaker: u4672
lines.text: You sure? I just got a shipment of espresso from Sicily. Special blend. Can't find anything like it in the States.

lines.speaker: u4656
lines.text: I'm good.   Really.

lines.speaker: u4672
lines.text: Okay. I understand you're interested in one of our properties?

lines.speaker: u4656
lines.text: Yeah. That warehouse over on Merchant Street. The volume on our import business has risen dramatically. The proceeds this quarter will be supernumerary due to the --

lines.speaker: u4672
lines.text: -- Super what?

lines.speaker: u4656
lines.text: Supernumerary. It means better than expected.

lines.speaker: u4672
lines.text: Then why not just fuckin' say better than expected? Everybody knows what better than expected means.

lines.speaker: u4656
lines.text: I'm taking a vocabulary course to enhance my communication skills.

lines.speaker: u4672
lines.text: Okay.   How much?

lines.speaker: u4656
lines.text: I'm not here to negotiate.

lines.speaker: u4672
lines.text: Why are you here?

lines.speaker: u4656
lines.text: To tell you that we're interested in the property.

lines.speaker: u4672
lines.text: You told me that on the phone. What the hell are you doing here? Showing off your communication skills? Go back to your people and tell them when they're serious to put a number on the table.

lines.speaker: u4656
lines.text: I will relay the particulars of our conversation to Mr. Maranzano.

lines.speaker: u4672
lines.text: Yeah -- you do that.

lines.speaker: u4657
lines.text: This plane will take you to Canada. From there you can fly back to Paris.

lines.speaker: u4658
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.speaker: u4657
lines.text: You have something for me?

lines.speaker: u4662
lines.text: Okay, we're square now, right?

lines.speaker: u4658
lines.text: There's just one more thing I need you to do.

lines.speaker: u4665
lines.text: Tell me the truth Hector... do you think we'll find my car?

lines.speaker: u4659
lines.text: Hard to say.

lines.speaker: u4660
lines.text: What hotel?

lines.speaker: u4669
lines.text: The Holiday Hotel.

lines.speaker: u4660
lines.text: What room number?

lines.speaker: u4669
lines.text: I don't know.     I didn't look.

lines.speaker: u4660
lines.text: Go look.

lines.speaker: u4661
lines.text: When we get to the next corner jump out.

lines.speaker: u4666
lines.text: I'm not going to leave you.

lines.speaker: u4661
lines.text: We both know I'm already dead.

lines.speaker: u4663
lines.text: Fine. All of you want to be angry? Be angry... but I'm the one who took the ball and that makes it mine.

lines.speaker: u4667
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: u4663
lines.text: Give it to me, Sami.

lines.speaker: u4667
lines.text: No!

lines.speaker: u4672
lines.text: What happened?

lines.speaker: u4664
lines.text: They sort of got away.

lines.speaker: u4672
lines.text: I see. Well, get back out on the street and find them before I "sort of" kill you.

lines.speaker: u4665
lines.text: Anybody know about that car outside?

lines.speaker: u4672
lines.text: Yeah.   It's mine.

lines.speaker: u4665
lines.text: No.   It's mine.

lines.speaker: u4672
lines.text: The hell it is.

lines.speaker: u4665
lines.text: I'm telling you that's my car!   And someone's gonna pay for it!

lines.speaker: u4672
lines.text: And I'm tellin' you it ain't! Now, turn your taco-eating ass around and get the hell out of here.

lines.speaker: u4665
lines.text: Fuck you, grease-ball!

lines.speaker: u4672
lines.text: Fuck me?   Fuck you!

lines.speaker: u4666
lines.text: The new Beaujolais' come out in France next week. You like wine?

lines.speaker: u4667
lines.text: I'm more of a whiskey drinker myself.

lines.speaker: u4666
lines.text: J&B?

lines.speaker: u4667
lines.text: Glenmorangie.

lines.speaker: u4666
lines.text: Glenmorangie is very good.

lines.speaker: u4667
lines.text: Why?

lines.speaker: u4668
lines.text: Vincent Bastaldi is in jail.

lines.speaker: u4672
lines.text: What's this?

lines.speaker: u4670
lines.text: A car.

lines.speaker: u4672
lines.text: Oh really? Thanks. I thought it was a sewing machine. What the hell is it doing here?

lines.speaker: u4670
lines.text: It's for you.

lines.speaker: u4672
lines.text: For me? What am I going to do with a piece of shit like this?

lines.speaker: u4670
lines.text: I don't know. Sell it. It's gotta be worth something. Someone gave it to me. C'mon Frankie, I'm trying to make good here.

lines.speaker: u4672
lines.text: Okay.    Okay.

lines.speaker: u4670
lines.text: I'll get you the papers tomorrow.

lines.speaker: u4674
lines.text: She's crazy.  You should have killed her.

lines.speaker: u4688
lines.text: I didn't have the heart.

lines.speaker: u4674
lines.text: Well, Li Mu Bai can do it.

lines.speaker: u4687
lines.text: I don't care about your sword.

lines.speaker: u4675
lines.text: Why were you spying on the Yus?

lines.speaker: u4687
lines.text: I'm looking for someone.  Jade Fox. I'm a police inspector from Shaan Xi, Gen Su district.  Jade Fox is a master criminal.  I hear she infiltrated the Yus.  She must have come with them when they transferred here.  But with Yu's reputation, I can't just go in and accuse her.

lines.speaker: u4675
lines.text: This Jade Fox is a woman?

lines.speaker: u4687
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: u4675
lines.text: Then leave her to me.

lines.speaker: u4687
lines.text: Pardon me, but I doubt you can handle her.  My wife was quite a martial arts expert.  Jade Fox killed her.  So you see, this is personal.  Leave her to me.

lines.speaker: u4676
lines.text: Go ahead.

lines.speaker: u4682
lines.text: Why should I?  You need practice. I can teach you to fight with the Green Destiny, but first you must learn to hold it in stillness.

lines.speaker: u4676
lines.text: Why do you want to teach me?

lines.speaker: u4682
lines.text: I've always wanted a disciple worthy of Wudan's secrets.

lines.speaker: u4676
lines.text: And if I use them to kill you?

lines.speaker: u4682
lines.text: That's a risk I'm willing to take. Deep down, you're good.  Even Jade Fox couldn't corrupt you.

lines.speaker: u4682
lines.text: Who are you?  Why is the Green Destiny in your possession?

lines.speaker: u4677
lines.text: What's it to you?

lines.speaker: u4682
lines.text: My name is Li Mu Bai.  The Green Destiny is mine.  Jade Fox can't be your master.  Where did you learn that "Xuan Piu" move?

lines.speaker: u4677
lines.text: I'm just playing around.

lines.text: Listen, Fritz, if I have to listen to another word from you I'll give you a fucking good hiding.

lines.speaker: u5046
lines.text: Fritz?  What are you talking about? Who's Fritz?

lines.speaker: u5050
lines.text: That's your name innit?  Count Fucking Arsehole Von Bismarck? What's that supposed to be then, Irish?

lines.speaker: u5051
lines.text: No, I'll get you some tea. Wait till you're in Naples.  You'll find a girl there.

lines.speaker: u5047
lines.text: Just kiss me.  It would mean such a lot to me.

lines.speaker: u5051
lines.text: Would it? She kisses him, very softly, on the lips.

lines.speaker: u5047
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.speaker: u5048
lines.text: You get to the morning and the poison leaks away, doesn't it? Black nights, fucking black nights, when you want to howl like a dog. I thought I would kill you.  You killed my friends, you ruined my hands.  But the girl was always here, like some Guardian Angel.

lines.speaker: u5062
lines.text: You can't kill me.  I died years ago.

lines.speaker: u5048
lines.text: No, now I can't kill you.

lines.speaker: u5057
lines.text: And a special thank you to Geoffrey and Katharine, without whose fund raising heroics we should still be kicking our heels. They toast the Cliftons.

lines.speaker: u5049
lines.text: To arm-twisting.

lines.speaker: u5057
lines.text: Did Katharine say? - Geoffrey has to fly back to Cairo.

lines.speaker: u5049
lines.text: Have to return the favor - take a few photographs for the army.

lines.speaker: u5051
lines.text: You've got a mustache.

lines.speaker: u5061
lines.text: A bit of one.

lines.speaker: u5051
lines.text: I was looking forward to this evening.

lines.speaker: u5061
lines.text: I had a hotel room.

lines.speaker: u5051
lines.text: I thought that was for when we were very very old?

lines.speaker: u5061
lines.text: I'm feeling old.

lines.speaker: u5052
lines.text: You've got to cut, sir, that frost won't last.

lines.speaker: u5055
lines.text: Go away.

lines.speaker: u5052
lines.text: Yessir.

lines.speaker: u5055
lines.text: This is making me incredibly angry.

lines.speaker: u5056
lines.text: You should sit down, darling.  She's quite all right.  Are you pregnant?

lines.speaker: u5054
lines.text: I don't think so.

lines.speaker: u5056
lines.text: How romantic.  With Fiona I fell over every five minutes.  Ronnie Christened me Lady Downfall.

lines.speaker: u5054
lines.text: I think I might go inside and sit down for a few minutes.

lines.speaker: u5056
lines.text: I'll come with you.

lines.speaker: u5054
lines.text: No, please.  I shall be absolutely fine. They pass Almsy, who doesn't look up from his book.

lines.speaker: u5055
lines.text: They're excited!  They're happy about destroying a whole city. Would they do that to a White Man's City?  Never!

lines.speaker: u5062
lines.text: Go on, do it.  I don't need to hear any more.

lines.speaker: u5062
lines.text: Am I being interrogated?  You should be trying to trick me.  Ask me about Tottenham Hotspur.  Or Buckingham Palace. About Marmite - I was addicted.  Or make me speak German, which I can, by the way.

lines.speaker: u5059
lines.text: Why?  Are you German?

lines.speaker: u5062
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: u5059
lines.text: How do you know you're not German if you don't remember anything?

lines.speaker: u5062
lines.text: You tell me.  I remember a lot of things. I remember a garden, plunging down to the sea - the Devil's Chimney we called it - and there was a cottage at the bottom, right on the shore, nothing between you and France.

lines.speaker: u5059
lines.text: This was your garden?

lines.speaker: u5062
lines.text: Or my wife's.

lines.speaker: u5059
lines.text: Then you were married?

lines.speaker: u5062
lines.text: I think so.  Although I believe that to be true of a number of Germans. Might I have a glass of water?

lines.speaker: u5063
lines.text: Gin? Where the hell are you?

lines.speaker: u5064
lines.text: I'm in the middle.

lines.speaker: u5063
lines.text: In the middle? You've got the Mask, why don't we have him?

lines.speaker: u5064
lines.text: He's on to something bigger.

lines.speaker: u5063
lines.text: Listen to me. Whatever you're doing, stop. Pull out.

lines.speaker: u5064
lines.text: Too late now.

lines.speaker: u5063
lines.text: Tell me where you are, or just leave the line open so I can trace you.

lines.speaker: u5064
lines.text: I'm going to get him, I promise you.

lines.speaker: u5066
lines.text: A true master. Classic, yet extremely sexual, don't you think?

lines.speaker: u5064
lines.text: We need to make the trade tomorrow.

lines.speaker: u5066
lines.text: Always in a rush.

lines.speaker: u5064
lines.text: You should know, when I come back here with the Mask--if anything goes wrong, a detailed description of everything you've done goes to the PRC.

lines.speaker: u5066
lines.text: Gin, really.

lines.speaker: u5064
lines.text: Tomorrow. It has to be tomorrow. Or forget the Mask.

lines.speaker: u5067
lines.text: See you.

lines.speaker: u5065
lines.text: Probably not.

lines.speaker: u5067
lines.text: Yeah. Probably not.

lines.speaker: u5068
lines.text: Um, Erin?  Listen.  Even though you're not necessarily my favorite person in the world ...  ... sometimes you're not half-bad.

lines.speaker: u5076
lines.text: I'm gonna assume that was meant as a compliment, Anna, and just say thank you.

lines.speaker: u5074
lines.text: Tell you what, why don't you go on over to reception, tell them I said Mario should take you to the airport.

lines.speaker: u5069
lines.text: Hey, excellent.  Thanks.

lines.speaker: u5074
lines.text: Fax these to this number, okay?

lines.speaker: u5070
lines.text: All of 'em?

lines.speaker: u5074
lines.text: All of them.

lines.speaker: u5076
lines.text: What?  Hey -- <u>he</u> hit <u>me</u>.

lines.speaker: u5071
lines.text: So you say.

lines.speaker: u5076
lines.text: He came tearing around the corner, out of control --

lines.speaker: u5071
lines.text: An ER doctor who spends his days saving lives was the one out of control --

lines.speaker: u5076
lines.text: That asshole smashed in my fucking neck!

lines.speaker: u5078
lines.text: Meningitis?  What the hell is meningitis?

lines.speaker: u5072
lines.text: It's an inflammation of the spinal cord and part of the brain.

lines.speaker: u5078
lines.text: Jesus.

lines.speaker: u5072
lines.text: She must be a tough cookie, cause it's a pretty advanced case.  I'd say she's been walking around with it for a few weeks now.

lines.speaker: u5078
lines.text: How does someone get meningitis?

lines.speaker: u5072
lines.text: Usually, in adults, it's from exposure to bacteria or a virus or ...

lines.speaker: u5078
lines.text: ... or lemme guess -- toxic waste?

lines.speaker: u5073
lines.text: I can put them in a good school.

lines.speaker: u5076
lines.text: Any school you want.

lines.speaker: u5073
lines.text: And get someone to help around the house.

lines.speaker: u5076
lines.text: Yup.

lines.speaker: u5073
lines.text: Oh my God.  Oh my God.

lines.speaker: u5086
lines.text: I've also been thinking about the team. Responsibilities, who should cover what --

lines.speaker: u5074
lines.text: Right.

lines.speaker: u5086
lines.text: I think we should makes some changes.

lines.speaker: u5076
lines.text: How come you didn't say anything when you found these things?

lines.speaker: u5075
lines.text: At the time, I thought, I got six kids, some of 'em want to go to college.  I can't afford to lose my job.  I told myself I was being honorable.  But there's nothing honorable in what I did.  Maybe that's why they picked me for the job. Maybe they knew what kind of man I was.

lines.speaker: u5085
lines.text: I gotta say, Erin -- first time I saw you, I did not peg you as the kind to go off and conduct her own epidemiological study.

lines.speaker: u5076
lines.text: Don't go telling anyone.  It'll ruin my reputation.

lines.speaker: u5090
lines.text: It was .... the Emperor ....

lines.speaker: u5104
lines.text: The Emperor?

lines.speaker: u5090
lines.text: Yes, he commands you make contact with him ....

lines.speaker: u5104
lines.text: Move this ship out of the asteroid field and into a position where we can send a clear transmission.

lines.speaker: u5090
lines.text: Yes, My Lord.

lines.speaker: u5104
lines.text: And code the signal to my private chamber.

lines.speaker: u5091
lines.text: Lord Vader, our ships have completed their scan of the area and found nothing.  The Millennium Falcon definitely went into lightspeed. It's probably on the other side of the galaxy by now.

lines.speaker: u5104
lines.text: Alert all commands.  Calculate every possible destination along their last known trajectory and disburse the fleet to search for them.  Don't fail me again, Admiral, I've had quite enough!

lines.speaker: u5091
lines.text: Yes, My Lord.  We'll find them.

lines.speaker: u5092
lines.text: Will you?  You underestimate The Emperor.  It is you he wants ... that is why your friends suffer.

lines.speaker: u5100
lines.text: And that is why I must go.

lines.speaker: u5092
lines.text: Luke, I will not lose you to the Emperor, as I lost Vader.

lines.speaker: u5100
lines.text: You won't.

lines.speaker: u5092
lines.text: Only a fully trained Jedi Knight, with The Force as his ally, will conquer Vader and his Emperor. If you end your training now, if you choose the quick and easy path ... as Vader did ... you will become an agent of evil ... and the galaxy will be plunged deeper into the abyss of hate, despair and pain that you feel your friends suffering now.

lines.speaker: u5099
lines.text: Okay, Chewie, it's now or never.

lines.speaker: u5093
lines.text: Barks his agreement.

lines.speaker: u5100
lines.text: ... I told you, I'm not hungry.

lines.speaker: u5094
lines.text: Patience.  It's time to eat.

lines.speaker: u5100
lines.text: Look, it smells good.  I'm sure it's delicious   But I don't know why we can't see Yoda now.

lines.speaker: u5094
lines.text: It's the Jedi's time to eat, too.

lines.speaker: u5100
lines.text: Will it take long to get there? How far away is he?

lines.speaker: u5094
lines.text: Not far, not far.  Be patient. Soon you will see him.  Why wish you become a Jedi?

lines.speaker: u5100
lines.text: Because of my father, I guess.

lines.speaker: u5094
lines.text: Oh, your father ... a powerful Jedi was he, powerful Jedi.

lines.speaker: u5100
lines.text: How could you know my father? You don't even know who I am.  Can't we get on with this already?

lines.speaker: u5095
lines.text: The night storms will start before you can reach the first marker.

lines.speaker: u5097
lines.text: Then I'll see you in Hell.

lines.speaker: u5104
lines.text: What is thy bidding, My Master?

lines.speaker: u5096
lines.text: There is a grave disturbance in The Force.

lines.speaker: u5104
lines.text: I have felt it.

lines.speaker: u5096
lines.text: Our situation is most precarious. We have a new enemy who could bring about our destruction.

lines.speaker: u5104
lines.text: Our destruction?  Who?

lines.speaker: u5096
lines.text: The son of Skywalker.  You must destroy him ... or he will be our undoing.

lines.speaker: u5104
lines.text: He's not a Jedi, he's just a boy. Obi-wan could not have taught him so much that ...

lines.speaker: u5096
lines.text: You are weak!  I have seen it. The Force is strong with him. He must be destroyed.

lines.speaker: u5104
lines.text: But, if he could be turned, he would be a powerful ally.

lines.speaker: u5096
lines.text: Yes ... yes.  That would be a great asset.

lines.speaker: u5104
lines.text: He will join us or die, My Master.

lines.speaker: u5098
lines.text: Don't shoot!  I've done what I can for you.  I'm sorry it's not better, but I've got my own problems.  I've already stuck my neck out further than I should ...

lines.speaker: u5097
lines.text: Yeah, you're a real hero.

lines.speaker: u5098
lines.text: I'm sure my men fixed it.  We've got nothing to worry about.

lines.speaker: u5099
lines.text: That sounds familiar.

lines.speaker: u5099
lines.text: This hyperdrive had better work.

lines.speaker: u5100
lines.text: I've never seen it fail.

lines.speaker: u5104
lines.text: There is no escape.  You must join me or die.  Don't make me destroy you here ... The Emperor is strong with The Force.  But if you join me, together we could overthrow Him.  Do not resist. It is our destiny!

lines.speaker: u5100
lines.text: Never.

lines.speaker: u5101
lines.text: Seventeen ships destroyed, we don't know how many got away.

lines.speaker: u5104
lines.text: Anything on the Millennium Falcon?

lines.speaker: u5101
lines.text: It won't get through the blockade.

lines.speaker: u5104
lines.text: I want that ship.

lines.speaker: u5107
lines.text: Excuse me.  I didn't mean to disturb....  What am I saying?

lines.speaker: u5106
lines.text: They're...pretending to dress.

lines.speaker: u5107
lines.text: What d'you mean, pretending? They are dressing.  Where'd they get those clothes?

lines.speaker: u5108
lines.text: To a lot of psychiatric small talk --

lines.speaker: u5110
lines.text: And we can watch ...

lines.speaker: u5108
lines.text: A display of primitive apparatus --

lines.speaker: u5112
lines.text: May I say something personal?

lines.speaker: u5109
lines.text: Please

lines.speaker: u5112
lines.text: I like you.

lines.speaker: u5113
lines.text: You were injected with glucose. There is no Plutoxin 7 virus. You were never going to die - at least not from anything we gave you.

lines.speaker: u5116
lines.text: C'mon, Snake - it's L.A. Everything's phony, you know that.

lines.speaker: u5117
lines.text: Oh Cuervo...

lines.speaker: u5114
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: u5117
lines.text: It's so good to see you again.

lines.speaker: u5114
lines.text: Where's Plissken?

lines.speaker: u5117
lines.text: He's... near.

lines.speaker: u5114
lines.text: You're stalling, Eddie.  Talk, you little gringo!

lines.speaker: u5117
lines.text: Cuervo, look out behind you!

lines.speaker: u5120
lines.text: I think we've burned off enough fuel. We may be lighter enough to hover. Just barely.

lines.speaker: u5115
lines.text: Can you land?

lines.speaker: u5120
lines.text: No. The right skid's broken. If I try to set it down she'll crash. I have to stay in a hoverwhile you jump off.  Hey, Carjack. We gotta hide the girl. Give her your dress.

lines.speaker: u5115
lines.text: My name is no longer Carjack. Will you please get that through your fucking head?

lines.speaker: u5116
lines.text: Relax, war hero. We took you for a ride, and you came through. Not bad for a dirtbag like you.

lines.speaker: u5121
lines.text: You're free, Plissken. But if you even so much as break wind on a country road I'll crush you like a bug.

lines.speaker: u5120
lines.text: Is that what I think it is?

lines.speaker: u5117
lines.text: Yeah. The place kept changing owners. Finally went bankrupt. That thing in Paris killed 'em.

lines.speaker: u5118
lines.text: Say, you need anything, Snake? Guns? Explosives? I can get you a crate of hellfire grenades, no problem - five hours.

lines.speaker: u5120
lines.text: Yeah. So how do I get to Venice?

lines.speaker: u5118
lines.text: All the sewers are collapsed under Venice. You have to go topside. Right up there.

lines.speaker: u5119
lines.text: You ain't doin' so good, Snake. You need help.  You should talk to Hershe. She hates Cuervo. They used to be partners, but they split up.

lines.speaker: u5120
lines.text: Who?

lines.speaker: u5119
lines.text: Hershe. She lives downtown with Mojo Dellasandro in the big boat. Down that way.

lines.speaker: u5120
lines.text: The President's promised to give whoever helps me 1 million dollars.

lines.speaker: u5122
lines.text: Yeah? Greenbacks? I got ten million of them.

lines.speaker: u5120
lines.text: Uh-uh. Bluebacks.

lines.speaker: u5127
lines.text: I loved you much, as King, and sometimes as husband, but one cannot gaze too long at the sun in the sky.

lines.speaker: u5125
lines.text: Forgive me, my wife, if you can. I was not born to live a man's life, but to be the stuff of future memory. The fellowship was a brief beginning, a fair time that cannot be forgotten; and because it will not be forgotten, that fair time may come again. Now once more I must ride with my knights to defend what was, and the dream of what could be.

lines.speaker: u5127
lines.text: I have kept it.

lines.speaker: u5126
lines.text: Who does it serve?

lines.speaker: u5133
lines.text: You, my lord.

lines.speaker: u5126
lines.text: I have waited long for you. Once you almost saw, but fear blinded you. Why am I served from the chalice?

lines.speaker: u5133
lines.text: Because you and the land are one.

lines.speaker: u5126
lines.text: I am wasting away and I cannot die. And I cannot live.

lines.speaker: u5133
lines.text: You and the land are one. Drink from the chalice. You will be reborn and the land with you.

lines.speaker: u5129
lines.text: The King without his sword, the land without a king...

lines.speaker: u5127
lines.text: We are to blame.

lines.speaker: u5133
lines.text: I have found you. The Queen. An apple. Tomorrow. Sir Gawain...

lines.speaker: u5129
lines.text: --It must wait, child. These good ladies, for whom I intervened once, will honor me with a meal. I am beholden to them now as I was when they begged my protection.

lines.speaker: u5130
lines.text: It's not for you, Uther, hearth and home, wife and child.

lines.speaker: u5135
lines.text: To kill and be king, is that all?

lines.speaker: u5130
lines.text: Maybe not even that, Uther. I thought once that you were the one to unite the land under one sword. But it'll take another, a greater king...

lines.speaker: u5135
lines.text: You strike me with words as hard as steel.

lines.speaker: u5130
lines.text: They are not weapons, my friend, but truths. You betrayed the Duke, stole his wife and took his castle, now no one trusts you. Lot, Uryens, your allies will turn against you. Give me the child, Uther, I will protect him. Go back to your war tent.

lines.speaker: u5138
lines.text: What honey?

lines.speaker: u5136
lines.text: Fuck it.

lines.speaker: u5137
lines.text: You're convinced that it's genuine.

lines.speaker: u5144
lines.text: I don't know. No, not really I suppose. But I've made a prudent judgement that it meets the conditions set down in the Ritual.

lines.speaker: u5137
lines.text: You'd want to do the exorcism yourself?

lines.speaker: u5144
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: u5137
lines.text: It might be best to have a man with experience. Maybe someone who's spent time in the foreign missions.

lines.speaker: u5144
lines.text: I see, your excellency.

lines.speaker: u5137
lines.text: Let's see whose around. In the meantime I'll call you as soon as I know.

lines.speaker: u5144
lines.text: Thank you your excellency.

lines.speaker: u5141
lines.text: There haven't been more than a hundred authenticated cases of so- called split personality, Mrs. MacNeil. Now I know the temptation is to leap to psychiatry, but any reasonable psychiatrist would exhaust the somatic possibilities first.

lines.speaker: u5138
lines.text: So what's next?

lines.speaker: u5141
lines.text: A pneumoencephelogram, I would think, pin down that lesion. It will involve another spinal.

lines.speaker: u5138
lines.text: Oh, Christ.

lines.speaker: u5141
lines.text: What we missed in the EEG and the arteriogram could conceivably turn up there. At the least, it would eliminate certain other possibilities.

lines.speaker: u5145
lines.text: Do you like films?

lines.speaker: u5142
lines.text: Sure.

lines.speaker: u5145
lines.text: I get passes. In fact I got a pass for The Crest tomorrow night. Would you like to go?

lines.speaker: u5142
lines.text: What's playing.

lines.speaker: u5145
lines.text: Withering Heights.

lines.speaker: u5142
lines.text: Who's in it?

lines.speaker: u5145
lines.text: Heathcliff, Jackie Gleason, and in the role of Catherine Earnshaw, Lucille Ball.

lines.speaker: u5142
lines.text: I've seen it.

lines.speaker: u5145
lines.text: Another one. Had your lunch?

lines.speaker: u5142
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: u5145
lines.text: Hey, Father? You like movies?

lines.speaker: u5144
lines.text: Very much.

lines.speaker: u5145
lines.text: I get passes to the best shows in town. Mrs. K though, she gets tired and never likes to go.

lines.speaker: u5144
lines.text: That's to bad.

lines.speaker: u5145
lines.text: Yeah, I hate to go alone. You know, I like to talk film; discuss the critique. D'you wanna see a film with me? I got passes to The Crest. It's Othello.

lines.speaker: u5144
lines.text: Who's in it?

lines.speaker: u5145
lines.text: Who's in it? Debbie Reynolds, Desdemona, and Othello, Groucho Marx. You're happy?

lines.speaker: u5144
lines.text: I've seen it.

lines.speaker: u5145
lines.text: One last time: Can you think of some priest who fits the bill?

lines.speaker: u5144
lines.text: Come on!

lines.speaker: u5145
lines.text: Answer the question, Father Paranoia.

lines.speaker: u5144
lines.text: Alright. You know who I think really did it?

lines.speaker: u5145
lines.text: Who?

lines.speaker: u5144
lines.text: The Dominicans. Go pick on them.

lines.speaker: u5145
lines.text: I could have you deported, you know that?

lines.speaker: u5146
lines.text: ...look down in pity...

lines.speaker: u5152
lines.text: You killed your mother!!! You left her alone to die!!!! She'll never forgive you!!! Bastard!!!

lines.speaker: u5154
lines.text: Miss?

lines.speaker: u5148
lines.text: Yes?

lines.speaker: u5154
lines.text: We want to see Mrs. Karras.

lines.speaker: u5148
lines.text: Do you have an appointment?

lines.speaker: u5154
lines.text: Yes

lines.speaker: u5148
lines.text: Are you a relative?

lines.speaker: u5154
lines.text: Yes I am her brother, he's the son

lines.speaker: u5148
lines.text: Just a minute.

lines.speaker: u5151
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: u5150
lines.text: Why not?

lines.speaker: u5151
lines.text: I'm afraid.

lines.speaker: u5150
lines.text: If he talks to me, I think he'll leave you. Do you want him to leave you?

lines.speaker: u5151
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: u5156
lines.text: Give me the keys.

lines.speaker: u5163
lines.text: You're not going to drive.

lines.speaker: u5156
lines.text: Give me the keys!

lines.speaker: u5163
lines.text: You're not going to drive!

lines.speaker: u5156
lines.text: It's my goddamn car!

lines.speaker: u5163
lines.text: It's our goddamn car!

lines.speaker: u5156
lines.text: Give me the keys.

lines.speaker: u5163
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: u5161
lines.text: What're you saying, Charlie?

lines.speaker: u5157
lines.text: Look, Frankie.  You and Jack been playing here, a long time.

lines.speaker: u5161
lines.text: Twelve years.

lines.speaker: u5157
lines.text: Right, twelve years.  Couple times a month.

lines.speaker: u5161
lines.text: So?

lines.speaker: u5157
lines.text: So maybe it's time we took a vacation from each other.

lines.speaker: u5161
lines.text: Vacation?  Christ, Charlie, it's a Monday night. You said so yourself.

lines.speaker: u5157
lines.text: It wasn't half full out there tonight, Frankie. I got six waiters standing in back listening to baseball.  I gotta move the liquor. To move the liquor, I gotta fill the tables. It's a matter of economics.  Me, I love you. I love both you guys, you know that. You're class.  But people today. They don't know class if it walks up and grabs 'em by the balls.

lines.speaker: u5158
lines.text: Honey ...

lines.speaker: u5161
lines.text: You believe this?  The kid won't come out.  I'm playing 'Camptown Races' for him and the next thing I know he's locked himself in the bathroom. There's nothing sharp in there, is there?

lines.speaker: u5158
lines.text: Honey ...

lines.speaker: u5161
lines.text: Where are our kids? Has he got one of them in there?

lines.speaker: u5158
lines.text: Frank.

lines.text: Cmon Jack...

lines.speaker: u5200
lines.text: I mean it.  From what I can tell, were a mom and pop operation, were already over-extended in sales, and any price advantage we could offer would easily be matched by a larger supplier...

lines.text: Congratulations. The La Guardia flights canceled but I got you out of Kennedy on United at nine. Am I good or what?

lines.text: Make sure you find Ben, bring him back here.  And keep it quiet.  I don't need this to hit the press.

lines.text: You're there in thirty minutes or I find you, Jerry, and I shoot you, and I shoot your fucking wife, and I shoot all your little fucking children, and I shoot 'em all in the back of their little fucking heads. Got it?

lines.text: You know about the guy who invented it? I hear all kinds of things. Supposedly, he was born in a mental institution.  They say he only sleeps one hour a night.  You know about this guy?  Tyler Durden?

lines.text: Let's pretend.  You're the Department of Transportation, and you discover that our company intentionally did nothing about leather seats cured in third world countries with chemicals we know cause birth defects?  Brake linings that fail after a thousand miles.  Fuel injectors that burn people alive.

lines.text: Just who the fuck do you think you are?!  Get out!  You're fired!

lines.text: What about this?  Keep me on payroll as an outside consultant.  In exchange for my salary, I'll keep my mouth shut.  I won't need to come to the office.  I can do this job from home.

lines.text: No.  No, sir.  I loved that condo. I loved every stick of furniture. The lamps, the chairs, the rugs, were me.  The dishes were me.  The plants were...

lines.text: I'd like to thank the academy...

lines.text: I got that beat.  So like, last May, I was supposed to stay at this cheesy bed and breakfast in Pennsylvania. There was a major gas leak no one knew about and all the guests suffocated during the night.

lines.text: He can't hear you.  Hi...I'm Dr. Weintraub....  I was on duty when they brought him in...I've been going over his record... He was brought in once before I understand...  ..."catatonic  stupor"...condition  rendered him non-verbal for a period of -...

lines.text: I'm afraid not ... Then again, I'm not sure. The beating's bad but it's not the problem... It seems he's.. re-experiencing the catatonia... So, like before, he could snap out it in an hour or in thirteen months or thirteen years... ....I don't know. There's no way to tell.

lines.speaker: u5310
lines.text: But..How could that happen?

lines.speaker: u5306
lines.text: Well, it's not unusual in his case... Sometimes victims of tragedies are subject to the brain's replay system. The brain never loses anything - it just stores it up and waits. A person could actually re-experience the full effect of a tragedy, long after the event took place. Are you relatives?  Well, it doesn't matter. We'll take care of it. He'll have to be sent back to the same institution..

lines.text: What if I was a relative?

lines.text: You'd have the option to care for him at home but my advice is it wouldn't be the best thing for him. He needs hospital care. I just thought you could sign the release forms, but the city can do that. I wouldn't feel responsible in any way. There's really nothing you can do. I'm sorry.

lines.text: All right, then.  I'll come by tomorrow for breakfast.

lines.speaker: u5564
lines.text: The central nervous system selects items from a constant storm of sensations.  Whatever was killed in your stroke appears to have short-circuited this mechanism. Parts of your brain now seem to be firing at random.

lines.speaker: u5572
lines.text: You're saying there's an electrical storm in my head?

lines.speaker: u5564
lines.text: That's as good a way as any to describe it.  I've seen far worse cases.  You might even learn to enjoy these walks down memory lane.

lines.speaker: u5572
lines.text: But the rest of it?  The killing headaches.  The phantom smells.  My inability to close my eyes without thinking a hundred things at once. It's all nothing more than bad electricity?

lines.speaker: u5564
lines.text: In a manner of speaking.  I've never encountered the olfactory hallucinations, but I'm sure they're related.

lines.speaker: u5572
lines.text: So what do I do?

lines.speaker: u5564
lines.text: Take the Luminal to sleep, or whenever you feel an attack coming on.

lines.speaker: u5572
lines.text: You seem to be saying that this isn't just a case of resting until I'm better.  That my condition will continue to deteriorate until the end of my life.

lines.speaker: u5566
lines.text: We'll be in touch, Jimmy.

lines.speaker: u5572
lines.text: Good-bye.  So nice to see you...

lines.speaker: u5568
lines.text: That is my daughter.  She say she and her husband are coming to town this afternoon.  I am sorry, Mr. Jimmy.  I will make it short.

lines.speaker: u5572
lines.text: I'll be out this afternoon, remember?  Your family can visit as long as they like.

lines.speaker: u5568
lines.text: No.  I do not cook for them.  My daughter's no-good husband will not take one bite of our food.

lines.speaker: u5572
lines.text: Mr....Kay?

lines.speaker: u5570
lines.text: Bet you thought you'd never see me again.  I didn't know if you'd be well enough to come to this party.

lines.speaker: u5572
lines.text: You didn't?

lines.speaker: u5570
lines.text: I'm the one who got you on Mr. Cukor's guest list.

lines.speaker: u5572
lines.text: You, Mr. Kay?  How do you know George Cukor?

lines.speaker: u5570
lines.text: I interviewed him after I met you. I'm his social secretary now. Well, assistant to his secretary.

lines.speaker: u5572
lines.text: I commend you.  If you're going to pursue poofs, go after those who can do favors for you.  You waste everybody's time when you court dinosaurs.

lines.speaker: u5570
lines.text: Don't think that, Mr. Whale.  I love your movies.  That's why I wanted you to come to this.  So I could see you with your monsters.

lines.speaker: u5572
lines.text: My monsters?

lines.speaker: u5570
lines.text: Don't go away.

lines.speaker: u5571
lines.text: Oh dear.  Have I made a blunder?

lines.speaker: u5572
lines.text: Ma'am, the pleasure is all mine.  James Whale.

lines.speaker: u5571
lines.text: I am such a goose.  I mistook you for Cecil Beaton.  It's the hat. You're wearing one of Cecil's hats, you know.

lines.speaker: u5573
lines.text: Ding Dong The Witch Is Dead, right?

lines.speaker: u5582
lines.text: Point-five ...

lines.speaker: u5574
lines.text: Well, that certainly won't do.

lines.speaker: u5582
lines.text: What do you mean -- ?

lines.speaker: u5574
lines.text: Look at it. I can't very well make delivery of that thing ...

lines.speaker: u5582
lines.text: You got no choice. It's over.

lines.speaker: u5574
lines.text: Fifty cars. Fifty cars by 8 AM Friday. Or Kip goes in that box. That was the deal ... Goddamn, it ... That was the deal ...

lines.speaker: u5575
lines.text: Okay, then. I'll catch you later, Randall ...

lines.speaker: u5584
lines.text: Double-meaning intended, right?

lines.speaker: u5575
lines.text: Right ...
